ref: 6192 daráyati ʻ causes to split ʼ RV. [~ daláyati. -- &rcirclemacr N. daryāunu ʻ to half -- crush ʼ caus. fr. pass. *darinu. <-> Various extensions of dar -- : -- -- kk -- : P. darakṇā ʻ to be split, have diarrhoea ʼ; Ku. darkaṇo intr. ʻ to split ʼ; N. darkanu ʻ intr. ʻ to split, be scarred (of a hillside), fall in torrents (of rain) ʼ; Or. darakibā ʻ to be torn ʼ, H. daraknā; -- -- ā̆ḍ -- : P. daraṛnā ʻ to grind coarsely ʼ; H. darāṛ m. ʻ crack ʼ; M. darāḍṇẽ ʻ to storm at, threaten ʼ; <-> -- al -- : Or. daraḷibā ʻ to knead, press together in a mass ʼ. -- Redup.: P. dardarā ʻ coarsely ground ʼ (or < dardara -- ); N. dardarnu ʻ to pound ʼ; M. dardarṇẽ ʻ to froth up ʼ.
